lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilvlIn AkulIn Bey cqr brn imil swDsMg jwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Livaleen Akuleen Bhaay , Chatar Baran Mili Saadhasang Jaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: With the union of the divine word and mind, a Guru-conscious person becomes free of high and low caste based differences. According to them, joining the ideal assembly of saintly people, the four castes become one only.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv lIn jl mIn giq guhj gvn jl pwn aunmwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Jal Meen Gati , Guhaj Gavan Jal Paan Ounamaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is engrossed in the divine word should be considered like a fish in water who lives and eat in the water. Thus the Guru-conscious person latently continue with the practicing of Naam Simran (meditation) and enjoy the elixir of divine name.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv lIn prbIn Bey pUrn bHm eykY eyk pihcwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Parabeen Bhaay , Pooran Braham Aykai Ayk Pahichaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-oriented people absorbed in the divine word become aware completely. They acknowledge the presence of One Lord in all the living beings.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv lIn pg rIn Bey gurmuiK sbd suriq aur AwnIAY ]147]
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Pag Reen Bhaay , Gurmukhi Sabad Surati Ur Aaneeai ?147?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who are engrossed in the Gur Shabad (Divine Word) become humble of disposition and feel like dust of the feet of holy men. It is because they are perpetually practicing meditation on Lord's name. (147)
